title: Every team is like a band
body:
**ADC **

*The Lead Guitar*

http://img4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110722022444/glee/images/f/f1/Spongebob-gif-rock.gif

Let's face it, this guy often shakes up the meta. From "dive the carry" to "protect the carry" to Stephen King's Carrie, this guy is up front and center. While assassin victims go from a hundred to zero faster than Hell freezing over, this guy melts towers faster than steel memes. 

This guy keeps teams together, he's the guy who makes everyone look good. If he/she (let's not leave out the ladies of league) is amazing, you'll be making labels and/or LP faster than CertainlyT inventing a new guitar solo (g-get it?). If they're shitty at what they do, everyone's going to be facepalming and/or clawing their eyes out. Nothing tanks a band faster than a bad lead guitar.

**Support**

*Bass Guitar*

https://24.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_lwvrvzzprT1r5ea5ko1_500.gif

This guy gets a lot of grief, barely any of the credit, and almost none of the bitches thanks to his job: making the lead guitarist look good so he can get less, more, and all of it. Sometimes. Other times you get that one god bass guitarist that causes earthquakes across the globe as people drop their underwear (why is it always the underwear? Why don't people drop, I don't know, their shoes or something?) faster than I can complete this sentence. 

**Jungler**

*Drummer*

http://31.media.tumblr.com/683b52e592926fbe66a885092699437c/tumblr_mw7egcihSI1rzqkj9o2_400.gif

This guy keeps everyone's shit together. No matter what instrument you play, percussion keeps the beat so you can too. The knot that ties every string together. The dad of the team. Christmas or whatever family holiday you find most appealing and/or believe in because I don't discriminate. Blah blah blah, this guy holds everyone who is separated, together.

The beat can be everywhere at once. The beat can be focused so one instrument in particular looks good. The drummer does it all.

**Mid Lane**

*Lead Singer*

http://37.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m39cp9N6h11qaus67o6_250.gif

Like the lead guitarist, but flashier. Sure, the lead guitar can have those cool guitar solos, but have you heard what amazing singers sound like? If your favorite artist is Justin Bieber or some boy band I've never heard of, then no you have not.

[Here's what real music sounds like.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JuYeHPFR3f0)

A good lead singer will have fans screaming your band's name, and sometimes the singer too. The band doesn't always have to perform well, but some good vocals will touch the hearts of fans everywhere.

**Top Lane**

*Lead Singer*

http://38.media.tumblr.com/4105b219b0cadee30f7bf9f4f36e21ec/tumblr_nh9kwszGDH1t89rpeo1_400.gif

Wait, no, the top laner is not an anime girl.

{{champion:92}} 

I stand corrected.

http://25.media.tumblr.com/f00136ad7a07fd178887dfd49008cadd/tumblr_mkcllhJOdd1rs6skro1_500.gif

Sometimes he's the guy telling everyone what to do... despite, you know, not even contributing at all. Sometimes he's the heart of the band, showing up when he's needed most to lift everyone's spirits and keep shit organized (and protecting your PR, and your future). Sometimes under-appreciated, sometimes despicable, but several bands have one anyway.

.

So what do teams look like to you?

replies.body: Wouldn't the support be the roadie?

I mean, uh, close. But in terms of the band's music, no. 

Unless you can play and be a roadie at the same time, but I wouldn't know.

I mean, you don't see Sona as Pentakill's roadie. Let's give supports a little credit.

Funny, I mostly play support and I studied bass for a while.

Weird thing is that I kind of like both.

Bass keeps a beat like the drums do, at least in some cases
